title.narrative: OUTP 3.3: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) POLICY, COORD & MGT

description.narrative: Output 3.3: Strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan and monitor scaling-up of rights- and gender-sensitive interventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2020, Zimbabweans have increased and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.3: Strengthened national capacity to legislate, coordinate, plan and monitor scaling-up of rights- and gender-sensitive interventions to promote safe drinking water, adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened the capacity of government to monitor WASH services through monitoring systems such as the Rural WASH Information Management System and Rapid Pro; as a result, 85% of urban centers and rural districts have functional monitoring systems. Also, the first comprehensive WASH joint sector review (JSR) since 2011 was undertaken, a key step in settling the direction for the sector in the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019
